when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when parting from someone, typically for a long time.
example: 友達にさようならを言いました。(Tomodachi ni sayounara o iimashita.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

when_to_say: Used when talking about vehicles or transportation.
example: 車で行きます。(Kuruma de ikimasu.) - I will go by car.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is new or recently made.
example: 新しい家です。(Atarashii ie desu.) - It is a new house.

when_to_say: Used when describing something that is old or aged.
example: 古い本があります。(Furui hon ga arimasu.) - I have an old book.

when_to_say: Used when describing speed or time.
example: 彼はとても早いです。(Kare wa totemo hayai desu.) - He is very fast.

when_to_say: Used when describing slowness or tardiness.
example: バスは遅れています。(Basu wa okureteimasu.) - The bus is late.

when_to_say: Used when referring to consuming food.
example: 寿司を食べます。(Sushi o tabemasu.) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used when referring to consuming beverages.
example: お茶を飲みます。(Ocha o nomimasu.) - I drink tea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to seeing or observing something.
example: 映画を見ます。(Eiga o mimasu.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to listening or inquiring.
example: 音楽を聞きます。(Ongaku o kikimasu.) - I listen to music.

when_to_say: Used when referring to meeting someone.
example: 友達に会います。(Tomodachi ni aimasu.) - I will meet my friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to running.
example: 公園で走ります。(Kouen de hashirimasu.) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when referring to purchasing something.
example: りんごを買います。(Ringo o kaimasu.) - I buy apples.

when_to_say: Used when referring to selling goods.
example: 店で本を売ります。(Mise de hon o urimasu.) - I sell books at the store.

when_to_say: Used when describing height or cost.
example: この家は高いです。(Kono ie wa takai desu.) - This house is expensive.

when_to_say: Used when describing affordability.
example: このペンは安いです。(Kono pen wa yasui desu.) - This pen is cheap.

when_to_say: Used when describing clear weather.
example: 今日は晴れです。(Kyou wa hare desu.) - It is sunny today.

when_to_say: Used when describing rainy weather.
example: 雨が降っています。(Ame ga futteimasu.) - It is raining.

when_to_say: Used when describing snowy weather.
example: 山に雪があります。(Yama ni yuki ga arimasu.) - There is snow on the mountain.

when_to_say: Used when describing windy conditions.
example: 風が強いです。(Kaze ga tsuyoi desu.) - The wind is strong.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sun.
example: 太陽が昇ります。(Taiyou ga noborimasu.) - The sun rises.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the moon.
example: 月がきれいです。(Tsuki ga kirei desu.) - The moon is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used when referring to stars.
example: 星がたくさん見えます。(Hoshi ga takusan miemasu.) - Many stars are visible.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sky.
example: 空が青いです。(Sora ga aoi desu.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used when referring to rivers or streams.
example: 川で泳ぎます。(Kawa de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the river.

when_to_say: Used when referring to mountains.
example: 山に登ります。(Yama ni noborimasu.) - I climb mountains.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the sea or ocean.
example: 海で泳ぎます。(Umi de oyogimasu.) - I swim in the sea.

when_to_say: Used when referring to forests or woods.
example: 森で散歩します。(Mori de sanpo shimasu.) - I walk in the forest.

when_to_say: Used when referring to flowers.
example: 花が咲きます。(Hana ga sakimasu.) - Flowers bloom.

when_to_say: Used when referring to birds.
example: 鳥が飛んでいます。(Tori ga tondeimasu.) - The bird is flying.
